Four qualities of a bad person [an4.73:9: Speaks ill of another even when not asked, let alone when asked
Speaks ill of another in full detail, not leaving anything out when led on by questions
Doesn’t speak well of another even when asked, let alone when not asked
Speaks well of themselves in full detail, not leaving anything out when led on by questions
Four qualities of a good person [an4.73:: Doesn’t speak ill of another even when asked, let alone when not asked
Speaks ill of another without giving the full details, leaving many things out when led on by questions
Speaks well of another even when not asked, let alone when asked
Speaks ill of themselves in full detail, not leaving anything out when led on by questions
Comparison of a bride and a mendicant [a: A bride on the day or night she’s first brought to her husband’s home sets up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for her mother and father in law, her husband, and even the bondservants, workers, and staff
After some time, because of living together and familiarity, she’ll even say to her mother and father in law, or to her husband: ‘Go away! What would you know?’

On the day or night a mendicant first goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, right away they set up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, and even the monastery workers and novices
After some time, because of living together and familiarity, they’ll even say to their teacher or mentor: ‘Go away! What would you know?’
